content.prompt: Two identical bar magnets are brought close together. The magnetic field lines of the two magnets are shown in the figure. A student claims that the poles of the magnets are aligned north pole to north pole. Which of the following correctly states whether the studentâ€™s claim is correct and provides a correct justification?

choices.label: Yes, because the magnetic field lines point away from the north poles.
Yes, because the magnets attract one another.
No, because the magnets repel one another.
No, because between the magnets the field lines point away from one magnet and toward the other.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
